  • Method Details

    • getJSONString

      public static java.lang.String getJSONString​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      It reads a json file and converts the content into a string so that afterwards we could use that to save Mongo DB database.
      Parameters:
      filename -
      Returns:
      a string consisting of the contents of the json file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException

    • gethHashString

      public static java.lang.String gethHashString​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      It creates a hash string of the contents of the file whose name is given as input. We use a SHA-256 algorithm to ensure that two hashes are same if and only if the contents of the 2 files are the same.
      Parameters:
      fileName -
      Returns:
      a unique hash for the contents of the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • getHashMapInDir

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getHashMapInDir​(java.lang.String dirPath) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.io.IOException
      For each file in the given directory we generate a hash based on its contents. that we add that file name, hash pair into a Hash Map. This will be used to determine to see if the files have changed or not during synchronization of Mongo DB
      Parameters:
      dirPath - path to the directory
      Returns:
      a hash map where keys are the file names ard the values are the hash strings of the content of that files.
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      java.io.IOException
